Articles.Content:
So I've been doing some testing and the flight report seems to be inaccurately reporting G-Forces when compared to Kerbal Engineer.

Does anyone have any info on why this is/how this happens? Which is considered more accurate?

3 hours ago, glen.mack said:

So I've been doing some testing and the flight report seems to be inaccurately reporting G-Forces when compared to Kerbal Engineer.

Does anyone have any info on why this is/how this happens? Which is considered more accurate?

Yeah, I don't know how KSP tracks it, but the g-force meter and max speed and other stuff seems unreliable.

As does the distance..by almost half

A flag planted then driven away from will show say 30km distance on the HUD but if you end the drive or flight itll show 15km on the flight report.. A usual observation on the KSC-Mountain loop I commonly run as a shakedown

Never knew why this is.. Itd be nice to have accuracy.. Is it a bug or is flight report somehow using anothet source of data?

I'm not sure. It'd make sense if it was a bug, since I've always viewed that menu as kinda a bonus, not important for Squad to focus on.

Flight report...

flight report?

oh, flight report! You mean the "F3 Tell me what broke report" button?

Edited January 20, 2016 by MarvinKitFox

Whenever I successfully launch a nuclear missile, it tells me it's a "catastrophic failure" when it's success.  Just kidding.  On a serious note, I think they haven't updated that at all since it was added.

Yeah the "ive been driving for hours, tell me how awesome I am" button

 

Its important for many challenges... One of KSPs attractions so id say its important to fix
